The IBDS describes the ambition and the approach for reaching these goals. The key points are:
- working towards technically, legally and ethically better considerations regarding data use
- develop government-wide system functions, like a federative data system
- Using concrete use cases with social value.

The strategy was send to Parlement in November 2021. In March 2023 an approach for the implementation in the coming years was published:  https://realisatieibds.pleio.nl/file/download/1c9729a6-70a9-4bda-a245-49c1d6d63adb/meerjarenaanpak-interbestuurlijke-datastrategie6maart2023.pdf RESPONSE: The strategy itself did not change, but there is now a document describing how to implement the strategy.

Justification: The Ministry of the Interior and Kingdom Relations is repsonsible for the open data policy. KOOP (Kennis en Exploitatiecentrum Officiele Overheidspublicaties) maintains the national open data portal. LEOO (Leer- en Expertisepunt Open Overheid) works on knowledge sharing about Open Data. As explained here: https://www.koopoverheid.nl/open-data--linked-data
The responsibilities of the national team (data.overheid.nl) are described here: https://data.overheid.nl/ondersteuning/algemeen/over-dataoverheidnl
The team maintaining the national portal is part of the national open data team.
The (chief) data officers are often also responsible for open data. Some organizations (for example CBS) have a dedicated open data officer.

Events and news items can be found on the website of the national data portal: https://data.overheid.nl/actueel
Knowledge and support is also shared via the website: https://data.overheid.nl/ondersteuning/data-publiceren/handreiking-open-data RESPONSE: Every 3 months there is a meeting about the national data strategy (https://realisatieibds.pleio.nl/events/view/f4bfbc3b-ef62-4ece-bc61-528c0b003c86/save-the-date-ibds-cafe-hoe-kunnen-data-maatschappelijke-opgaven-verder-helpen).

There are standard publication plans on national and local level provided by the National dataportal and biggest cities. These plans also implement the DCAT standardized value list for mandatory fields to fill during publication. There is in addition a staged publication process. The biggest data owning organization first publish data in internal catalogues, before it is published in the public and national datapportals.

The implementation of the IBDS (strategy) is handled by an organization (ICTU) focusing on the realisation of the strategy (see: https://realisatieibds.pleio.nl/) by stimulating and facilitating the intergovernmental cooperation.

The implementation program for IBDS started in 2022 and runs until 2031. This means that the implementation program has just started, and it's too early to state something about the level of implementation. Therefore the answer is neutral."

Data holders are assisted by data hubs that are handling specific data; 
- Rijkswaterstaat is a data hub that supports data holders that have real time data on the infrastructure via: https://waterinfo.rws.nl/#!/nav/index/. Which is a real-time platform that people can use and enter.
- A data hub like NDW (National Road database) helps to gather real time data from various data holders and convert this to usable data for public and private users. 
So activities are conducted by sector based data hubs to support data holders. The data hubs connect to the National dataportal.

Geonovum is assisting relevant stakeholders (also under the INSPIRE flag) with the publication of geo data. Acitivites include the coordination of a frequent meeting between stakeholders within the geo domain regarding open data matters, see: https://www.geonovum.nl/geo-standaarden/inspire-europese-leefomgeving

RIVM (National Institute for Public Health and the Environment) supports Citizen Science projects regarding measuring air quality: https://www.rivm.nl/lucht/meten-modelleren-berekenen/samen-meten  and supports the publication on this data portal: https://samenmeten.rivm.nl/dataportaal/

In the Who (Dutch law on the reuse  of governmental data) the definition of reuse is specified as follows:  hergebruik: het gebruik van informatie, neergelegd in documenten berustend bij een met een publieke taak belaste instelling, voor andere doeleinden dan het oorspronkelijke doel binnen de publieke taak waarvoor de informatie is geproduceerd, anders dan de uitwisseling van informatie tussen met een publieke taak belaste instellingen onderling uitsluitend met het oog op de vervulling van hun publieke taken; https://wetten.overheid.nl/BWBR0036795/2021-07-01

Yes, we use the statistics (also a lot of non-public figures in our Piwik Pro system) to steer the content production for impact stories, social media activities and need for support pages. Important here is how successful users are to find data without help.

We have a clearly defined metadata approach conform DCAT. So the government organisations can check if the metadata is up to date conform the standard. The datamanagement team of the portal every day checks if the (meta)data is right and if we miss datasets we contact the data owners. Documentation is published for anyone to check how to validate against the Dutch DCAT application profile of DCAT. Currently the DCAT-AP 2 DONL is being created which will implement DCAT AP 2

Full update of meta data description of data set, linkchecker to validate the existence of the set, push-pull mechanism for synchonization with other catalogs.

We validate at the moment metadata is synced from connected portals. Every dataset must validate against the mandatory setting in our Dutch DCAT application profile. If datasets do not validate, they can't be added to the portal. Responsibility is with the data owner to make sure their metadata validates.
We check the condition of links to resources every night. In the monitoring statistics results are shown (Quality of the data): https://data.overheid.nl/statistieken/monitor

We  have a team that actively checks and monitors the quality of the metadata. Either based on their own investigations, feedback from users or data requests from users, we can ask and assist data providers to publish their data in machine-readable formats. We provide documentation on data formats on our site: https://data.overheid.nl/ondersteuning/data-gebruiken/vormen-van-data

Data providers must use DCAT for publishing metadata. We are developing the Dutch implementation of DCAT-AP, DCAT-AP NL.
